Hello RJ=A0 You make good points here.=A0 I had to re look at the purpose o=
f the group to see if this was a scientific research group or other.=A0 It =
looks like it is in the "or other" category.=A0 I do believe there are stri=
ctly research groups around that can apply the rules of scientific testing.=
=A0 More in the hobbyist or enthusiast mode?
=A0
One=A0 of the reasons I jo=
ined this group=A0is because I appreciate members like Misty for posting th=
eir=A0work and not having to do so under some=A0scientific methodology.=A0=
=A0That, I think, would hinder innovation, testing, sharing and even enjoym=
ent of what we do here.=A0 And, again, it is not the stated purpose of this=
 group.=A0=A0Doubters and debunkers certainly have a place in this non-scie=
ntific arena, but here I hope to see posts from people who are not afraid t=
o=A0try a technique and then share it with others.=A0=A0I was looking for y=
our posts=A0with the group here...do you have any?=A0 I do not mean that as=
 a challenge...I am sincerely interested in hearing=A0your clips.=A0=A0=A0b=
est wishes=A0=A0 ron l=A0=A0

=A0

n Wed, 1/14/09, Rj <rasterer@...> wrote:


From: Rj <rasterer@yahoo.c=
om>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New Water EVP
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: =
Wednesday, January 14, 2009, 8:15 AM










I know what you mean Misty -=
 it does seem that interpretations are often varied.=A0 I am thinking that =
the best way to make progress is to get an audio sample that you think is m=
ost representative of a given approach's effectiveness, and send that priva=
tely to several people.=A0 Name the file something innocuous (like File1) a=
nd don';t tell the people you send it to what you think you hear.=A0 Also, =
ask the people not to discuss the file with anyone else, and have them send=
 what they think they hear directly back to you,rather than posting the res=
ults in a forum or group.

I think that kind of test is helpful, since it s=
eems to me that once someone tells me what the audio clip sounds like, then=
 it's hard for me to hear anything else in it.=A0 But,that could be influen=
cing my interpretation (like someone pointing to a cloud, telling me its a =
horse, and then I have trouble NOT seeing a horse) ,so it's better to liste=
n before it is suggested to me what i should be hearing.

This way, I think=
 the most progress can be made, because if people just keep confirming what=
 we think we hear, and it turns out it's just noise that we are forcing an =
interpretation into, we won't be making progress (though it might make us f=
eel good to believe that we're being successful).=A0 Getting negative feedb=
ack to one's approach is not as fun, and might feel like some non-believer =
is trying to debunk us.=A0 But, really, that can be the best feedback for p=
rogress, since it helps us to change tactics when our current approach is n=
ot effective, rather than continuing down an ineffective path, getting acco=
lades from friends, but missing out on other paths that might show more pro=
mise,.

I never know who will hear what. No matter which method is us=
ed. Everyone hears differently, different speaker setups, different softwar=
e. I just post a variety of whats clear to me using different methods. Some=
times the one thats not one I think of as clear is the one everyone agrees =
on as being clear. Go figure.

Misty

Content-Type: text/html; charset=us-ascii

<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" ><tr><td valign="top" style="font: inherit;"><DIV>Hello RJ  You make good points here.  I had to re look at the purpose of the group to see if this was a scientific research group or other.  It looks like it is in the "or other" category.  I do believe there are strictly research groups around that can apply the rules of scientific testing.  More in the hobbyist or enthusiast mode?</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>One  of the reasons I joined this group is because I appreciate members like Misty for posting their work and not having to do so under some scientific methodology.  That, I think, would hinder innovation, testing, sharing and even enjoyment of what we do here.  And, again, it is not the stated purpose of this group.  Doubters and debunkers certainly have a place in this non-scientific arena, but here I hope to see posts from people who are not afraid to try a technique and then share it with others.  I was looking for your posts with the group here...do you have any?  I do not mean that as a challenge...I am sincerely interested in hearing your clips.   best wishes   ron l  <BR></DIV>
<DIV><FONT face="comic sans ms" size=3><EM></EM></FONT> </DIV>
<DIV><FONT face="comic sans ms" size=3><EM></EM></FONT> </DIV>

<DIV><FONT face="comic sans ms" size=3><EM></EM></FONT> </DIV>
<DIV><FONT face="comic sans ms" size=3><EM>                                                  Reality Is Your Idea</EM></FONT></DIV><BR><BR>--- On <B>Wed, 1/14/09, <SPAN>Rj</SPAN> <I><rasterer@...></I></B> wrote:<BR>
<BLOCKQUOTE style="PADDING-LEFT: 5px; MARGIN-LEFT: 5px; BORDER-LEFT: rgb(16,16,255) 2px solid"><BR>From: Rj <rasterer@...><BR>Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New Water EVP<BR>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<BR>Date: Wednesday, January 14, 2009, 8:15 AM<BR><BR>
<DIV id=yiv1521001901>
<DIV id=ygrp-text>
<DIV>
<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>
<TBODY>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top>I know what you mean Misty - it does seem that interpretations are often varied.  I am thinking that the best way to make progress is to get an audio sample that you think is most representative of a given approach's effectiveness, and send that privately to several people.  Name the file something innocuous (like File1) and don';t tell the people you send it to what you think you hear.  Also, ask the people not to discuss the file with anyone else, and have them send what they think they hear directly back to you,rather than posting the results in a forum or group.<BR><BR>I think that kind of test is helpful, since it seems to me that once someone tells me what the audio clip sounds like, then it's hard for me to hear anything else in it.  But,that could be influencing my interpretation (like someone pointing to a cloud, telling me its a horse, and then I have trouble NOT seeing a horse) ,so it's better to listen
 before it is suggested to me what i should be hearing.<BR><BR>This way, I think the most progress can be made, because if people just keep confirming what we think we hear, and it turns out it's just noise that we are forcing an interpretation into, we won't be making progress (though it might make us feel good to believe that we're being successful).  Getting negative feedback to one's approach is not as fun, and might feel like some non-believer is trying to debunk us.  But, really, that can be the best feedback for progress, since it helps us to change tactics when our current approach is not effective, rather than continuing down an ineffective path, getting accolades from friends, but missing out on other paths that might show more promise,.<BR><BR><BR>--- On <B>Tue, 1/13/09, Misty Dawn <I><bulletbabea@ yahoo.com></I></B> wrote:<BR>
<BLOCKQUOTE style="BORDER-LEFT: rgb(16,16,255) 2px solid"><BR>From: Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@ yahoo.com><BR>Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New Water EVP<BR>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com<BR>Date: Tuesday, January 13, 2009, 7:37 PM<BR><BR>
<DIV id=yiv1524022871>
<DIV id=ygrp-text>
<DIV>Thanks RJ<BR><BR>I never know who will hear what. No matter which method is used. Everyone hears differently, different speaker setups, different software. I just post a variety of whats clear to me using different methods. Sometimes the one thats not one I think of as clear is the one everyone agrees on as being clear. Go figure.<BR><BR>Misty<BR><BR>--- On Tue, 1/13/09, Rj <<A rel=nofollow>rasterer@yahoo. com</A>> wrote:<BR><BR>> From: Rj <<A rel=nofollow>rasterer@yahoo. com</A>><BR>> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New Water EVP<BR>> To: <A rel=nofollow>EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com</A><BR>> Date: Tuesday, January 13, 2009, 3:56 PM<BR>> If you'd like some feedback, I could definitely make out<BR>> what sounded like water, and perhaps slowed down water. <BR>> But other than that, it seemed a strain to me to attribute<BR>> any of those noises to anything vocal or intelligent.<BR>> <BR>> Just my opinion,<BR>>
 <BR>> --- On Tue, 1/13/09, Misty Dawn<BR>> <<A rel=nofollow>bulletbabea@ yahoo.com</A>> wrote:<BR>> <BR>> From: Misty Dawn <<A rel=nofollow>bulletbabea@ yahoo.com</A>><BR>> Subject: [EVP-ITC] New Water EVP<BR>> To: <A rel=nofollow>EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com</A><BR>> Date: Tuesday, January 13, 2009, 10:31 AM<BR>> <BR>> <BR>> <BR>> <BR>> <BR>> <BR>> <BR>> <BR>> <BR>> <BR>> <BR>> Heres a few voices from my latest session<BR>> recording water then slowing down -74% in audacity. For me<BR>> they are quite loud and the clarity was great. I recorded<BR>> these on a night of the full moon (which does seem to help).<BR>> <BR>> <BR>> <BR>> Attaching a few of the clearer ones to this post and for<BR>> those who dont get the dailies you can listen on my esnips<BR>> site. For the other methods click on my profile there and<BR>> you will see folders listed.<BR>>
